meanings.definition: Intense and passionate feeling or emotion.
meanings.sent1: Her fervours for music were evident in the way she sang with so much emotion.
meanings.sent2: The crowd's fervours for their team could be heard in their loud cheers.
meanings.sent3: His fervours for ice cream led him to eat three cones in a row!
meanings.sent4: The fervours of the storm were reflected in the crashing waves and howling winds.
meanings.sent5: The fervours of love burned brightly in their hearts, never fading.

meanings.sent1: The fervours of the summer sun made everyone seek shade.
meanings.sent2: The fireplace provided much-needed fervours on the cold winter night.
meanings.sent3: The fervours of the sauna were too much for him to handle.
meanings.sent4: The fervours of the desert sun beat down relentlessly on the travelers.
meanings.sent5: The fervours of the bonfire kept them warm during the camping trip.
